title: Hawaii’s top power utility accused of years of mismanagement before the deadly wildfires
description: Hawaii’s biggest power utility faces growing scrutiny for the role it might have played in the deadliest wildfire in modern American history.

title: As tourists seek refunds for upcoming Maui trips, Airbnb offers muddled response
description: For an economy heavily dependent on tourism, Maui has come to rely on platforms like Airbnb to generate revenue.

title: Orlando debuts self-driving shuttle that will whisk passengers around downtown
description: There is going to be a new way to get around downtown Orlando, Florida, and it’s not going to require any human drivers.

title: Trump supporters post names and addresses of Georgia grand jurors online
description: The purported names and addresses of members of the Georgia grand jury that indicted Donald Trump have been posted online, along with other threats.

title: Raided Kansas newspaper to have seized items returned after search warrant is withdrawn
description: Police had "insufficient evidence" to raid the offices of a small Kansas newspaper — and seized belongings should be returned immediately, officials said Wednesday.

title: Republicans take aim at the Biden White House's emails with tech platforms
description: Emails from Facebook’s parent company are giving fresh momentum to Republicans’ long-standing claims that they’re being censored on social media.

title: What debate? Trump could time his Georgia arrest to blot out first matchup
description: Former President Donald Trump has the option of timing his booking in Georgia to coincide with Wednesday’s first Republican presidential primary debate.

title: Ohio teen convicted of intentionally crashing car at 100 mph, killing boyfriend and friend
description: An Ohio teenage girl was convicted of murder on Monday, accused of intentionally killing her boyfriend and his friend by crashing her car into a brick building going 100 mph last year.

title: Witnesses of Buffalo mass shooting file rare lawsuit against social media and gun companies
description: More than a dozen people who last year witnessed a white gunman open fire and kill 10 Black people at a Tops grocery store in Buffalo, New York, have filed a lawsuit over the trauma they endured.

title: Family and friends seek answers months after D.C. man's suspicious death
description: Ernest Terrell Newkirk was found facedown in the street missing his phone, wallet and car. His partner wants answers.

title: Extreme disasters are overwhelming safety systems not designed for climate-fueled events
description: Wildfires have torched parts of Maui before, but never anything as devastating as the ones that tore through Lahaina last week.

title: As pet insurance becomes more popular, owners complain about rising prices and denied claims
description: Americans had about 5.4 million pet insurance policies in 2022, up 21% from 2021. But as pet insurance has increased in popularity, consumer criticisms have risen too.

title: Town's police department quits and FL teachers worry new laws could get them fired: Morning Rundown
description: Get everything you need to know to start your day. Sign up to get the Morning Rundown newsletter to your email inbox.

title: A Hawaii senior recounts his 'dumb luck' escape as Maui struggles to identify dead
description: Hawaii senior Sanford Hill calls his escape from death “dumb luck” after the Lahaina wildfire destroyed his assisted living facility, Hale Mahaolu Eono.

title: Bradley Cooper accused of ‘Jewface’ over prosthetic nose in Leonard Bernstein biopic ‘Maestro’
description: Actor Bradley Cooper is facing mounting backlash over his apparent use of a prosthetic nose in his depiction of composer and conductor Leonard Bernstein in the upcoming movie "Maestro."

title: Emergency room doctors beg for help treating children with mental health illnesses
description: As the nation's pediatric mental health crisis worsens, influential medical groups are pleading for more support and resources to help children and teenagers with psychiatric concerns.

title: Matildas mania grips Australia as women’s team captures hearts of World Cup host
description: Women’s World Cup co-host Australia has developed a national obsession with its team, the Matildas, who face England in the semifinal on Wednesday.

title: Summer has been no sweat for California's increasingly green energy grid, but the hottest days may still lie ahead
description: Amid humanity's hottest-ever summer months, California, home of the hottest place on Earth, has enjoyed a relatively cool and stress-free energy supply.

title: GOP strategists warn Trump's post-indictment political resilience could falter after Georgia
description: Donald Trump’s sprawling new indictment in Georgia could have uniquely painful consequences for the former president’s effort to reclaim the White House, according to four Republican strategists with experience in Peach State politics.

title: Survivors of Maui fires set up their own aid network as trust in government falters
description: A week after wildfires roared across Maui, residents distrustful of the government response are setting up their own aid distribution network.
